actions.committee: House Committee on Banking and Currency
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking and Currency.

official_title: A bill to amend the Export Administration Act of 1969, to prevent the excessive drain of iron and steel scrap from the United States.

summary.text: States that prior to July 1, 1974, not more than 600,000 net tons of iron and steel scrap may be exported each calander month from the United States.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Export Administration Act of 1969, to prevent the excessive drain of iron and steel scrap from the United States.
